Haha look at me I'm so contrarian and kooky because I didn't recommend Half Life 2 xdxdxdxd

In all seriousness you already own this game and to be honest this series relevancy is maintained purely through the announcement of Half Life: Alyx and the fact that it was simply a god tier level game that is still capable of holding up to this day in terms of visuals and storytelling. I will say that combat is a straight downgrade from the first game in terms of options. No matter how cool or satisfying the gravity gun is I will still prefer to use my satchels, tripmines, and Tau cannon over the occasional physics kill.

But either way whatever just buy the game and play it if you haven't because lets be honest nothing I or anyone else says will stop you from playing it. Just play it.
nothing to say :P

Si tengo un juego con la historia que más me ha llegado es este, lo debo haber completado 50 veces o más junto a sus episodios y obvio el original. Una lástima que no se continuara su historia o se le diera un fin, aveces pienso que no fue del todo erroneo, porque me han mantenido viva la llama de esperanza y hoy con el anuncio de Half-Life: Alyx esa llama de intensifica!
En fin, la mejor banda sonora, historia súper atrapante y llena de incógnitas! EL MEJOR JUEGO DE MI VIDA !

[h1]Half life 2 is a Good Sequel.[/h1]

After I saw the trailer of [u]Half-Life Alyx[/u], I've decided to play through Half-Life 1 and 2. And I gotta say, I remember why I loved these games. [i]They're so immersive and the story is so mysterious and interesting that it just grabs you in and doesn't let go.[/i]

[list]
[*][u][b]What I like...[/b][/u]
[u]Storytelling is great.[/u] as I said in the previous review of Half-Life, the story is told through a First-Person Perspective, [b]so doing whatever you want during cutscenes is in your power.[/b] The voice acting is better and doesn't rush lines of dialogue like the first game did.

[u]The Atmosphere and ambient music is great.[/u] it's a very unique soundtrack and can get you really immersed. [i]It does reuse some old tracks from the original Half-Life,[/i] but hey it does fit in.

[*][b][u]What I didn't like...[/u][/b]
[u]Gameplay isn't really that good.[/u] Half-Life 1 had this problem and it seems like they kind of made it slightly sh*tty in my opinion. The enemies that you'll encounter more are mainly [b]Combine Soldiers[/b] which Utilize [u]Hitscan[/u] and [u]Line of Sight[/u]. So just like the first game, [i]as soon as they see you you're going to take damage.[/i] [b]But there accuracy is about as poor as a Stormtrooper so it's not really that bad.[/b]

[b]I don't like the Source Engine and its functionality.[/b] I've said this in my Entropy : Zero review and in my TF2 review, so if you want to know about my sh*tty opinion on this, here you go. 
https://steamcommunity.com/id/038G8J027IG10MOSQ/recommended/714070/
[/list]

[b]Overall[/b] [u]it's still a pretty good game and still holds up well despite its problems.[/u]

I would recommend this game, [b]but not this version[/b]. I would instead recommend
[u][b]Half-Life 2 Update[/b][/u].
https://store.steampowered.com/app/290930/HalfLife_2_Update/
This version focuses on fixing up the original game to work better on Modern systems.
[spoiler][i]"or from my experience just fixes bugs in certain Maps"[/i][/spoiler]
You still need to buy this version in order to play it, because Half-Life 2 Update is just a mod.

I would also recommend [u][b]M Mod[/b][/u]. 
https://www.moddb.com/mods/hl2-ep2-enhased-mod
[u]This mod improves the Gameplay and the quality of the game overall[/u]. It's a good mod if you ever want to revisit this game with a modern feel.

Nuevamente Valve lo hizo de nuevo con este juego. Han pasados 15 años desde que este juego abrió un nuevo concepto de video juegos rompiendo en la linea de lo absurdo para consolidarse como una gran historia digna de ser jugada. Puedo decir que este juego es como un buen vino, por mas que pase el tiempo siempre es embriagante poder jugar un par de horas. Valve nos presenta aquí al ya icónico heroe, Gordon Freeman, el hombre, la leyenda, el Físico Teorico que ya vimos en la primer saga, Half life. En un principio nos lo presenta de igual manera como lo vimos en el primer juego pero siguiendo sus travesías de este se va consolidándose como un héroe, un símbolo para la humanidad la esperanza necesaria para la lucha contra la alianza. Mas que resolver dudas del primero nos deja con mas de las que podemos digerir, no es malo simplemente es la temática.
Sin duda debes jugarlo, este juego es algo muy deferente, una artesania por así decirlo que no raya ni cae en errores comunes de hoy en día. Y como se dijo en el trailer de Alyx, "ellos hacen juegos" y vaya que si.
Es el Half Life 2 papa. Todo el mundo sabe que es un buen juego.
